meanings.definition: To bring different elements into a harmonious or efficient relationship.
meanings.sent1: She is coordinating the team's efforts for the project.
meanings.sent2: The manager is coordinating the schedules of all employees.
meanings.sent3: The dance instructor is coordinating the movements of the dancers with the music.
meanings.sent4: The conductor is like a coordinating force, guiding each musician to play in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The GPS system is coordinating the signals from multiple satellites to pinpoint the exact location.

meanings.definition: Serving to organize or integrate various elements.
meanings.sent1: The coordinating committee planned the event seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The coordinating colors of the room created a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The coordinating efforts of the volunteers made the charity event a success.
meanings.sent4: The coordinating role of the teacher helped students understand complex topics.
meanings.sent5: The coordinating design of the building allowed for easy navigation.
